column2: jerryinoz, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: To those who say they are having severe leg pain on this drug --- yes indeed! This medication and all others in the same class can cause severe leg and muscle problems. If this happens to you contact your doctor immediately. You need to be off it! I am having severe problems with dizziness, extreme tiredness and weakness since being put on Cardizem. I will stop taking it ASAP. This is the third calcium channel blocker my cardiologist has tried and I am not able to take any of them. I was much better without it. So, if it ain't broke, don't fix it!!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: On Xmas Day  8.5 yrs ago I went into A-Fib.Was hospitalized for 10 days .Had to useDefibulator to get me back to normal rythm.. Wore a Holt Monitor a few times so they could monitor my heart rate & to see if I would have other episodes..Been on this Medication for over  10 yrs+ it has been a lifesaver..  I highly reccomend it ..

column2: Dave, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this med for a week for irregular heatbeat ( my heart skips a beat every so often) and I haven't really noticed much difference in my symptoms. I have a low heart rate ( about 50 to 60 bpm ) and have to monitor my heart rate often on this med. I take 60mg twice a day and haven't noticed any real side affects other than some dizziness. Overall, if you take this med and it helps you, you probably can tolorate it very well.

column2: Shore, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: MY doctor prescribed this med after neck surgery.  I was having difficulty swallowing my 300mg capsules (CD). Due to post-op swelling, I crushed these pills in ice cream to take them.  The CD cannot be crushed. Took until swelling went down, then went back on cardizem CD 300mg daily. This pill saved me when I could not swallow.

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Lowered my B/P quickly but body aches and leg cramps remain a problem.

column2: lemdeb, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: had strange dreams, terrible night time leg and foot cramps and swelling of feet and ankles..Dr. changed my meds today and put me on something else. Had no idea these side effects were reelated at all to this drug until today.Tired all the time also.

column2: chappy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: a few weeks ago I had a attack of atrial fib.. and spent the night in the hospital.my pulse was at 175 beats per minute and my b/p was high and the doctors had given me lopressor but didnt work and then gave me this med and it brought it down, so I was sent home with this med and the only side effect I have had was some heartburn during the day and then some weakness but went away after about a week. as for the lady that cant pick up her head and having a hard time.. contact your doctor.. it may be more than the med. I take it at night.. also are you taking it with other meds. sometimes interactions happen.. try taking it at night without any other meds or at least wait 1 hour before taking other meds. so far the med seems to be working for me. there will be some side effects but usually go away after a few weeks. but after that if you are still having problems contact your doctor just dont stop taking the med. also it might be the wrong dose. I am taking 120mg once a day. try taking it at bedtime. that way the side effects wont bother you as much. if your blood pressure drops to low, you may experience weird feelings too. cause this med does bring down your b/p. just some helpful hints.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I experienced a flushed face, severe edema around my eyes,and in my hands and feet, and itching (hives) on my neck, arms and legs.

column9: Since I have been on Cardizem I am continually fighting bladder infections & the burning associated with a baldder infection.  Has anyone experienced this?
